skill.name: Command Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a slash command", "add a command", "write a custom command", "define command arguments", "use command frontmatter", "organize commands", "create command with file references", "interactive command", "use AskUserQuestion in command", or needs guidance on slash command structure, YAML frontmatter fields, dynamic arguments, bash execution in commands, user interaction patterns, or command development best practices for Claude Code.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a slash command", "add a command", "write a ...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: This is an official skill with documentation and examples only. It includes patterns that reference tools and files, but no executable code is shipped.

content.value_statement: You need consistent slash commands with clear arguments and safe tool usage. This skill provides structure, frontmatter guidance, and proven patterns.
actual_capabilities: Explains command file locations and naming conventions
Documents YAML frontmatter fields such as description, allowed-tools, and model
Shows dynamic arguments with $ARGUMENTS and positional parameters
Demonstrates file references using @ syntax for context loading
Provides bash execution patterns and tool filters
Covers plugin command organization with CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT
limitations: Does not execute commands or validate runtime results
Assumes required tools and permissions are available
Focuses on Claude Code command format, not other platforms

use_cases.title: Ship plugin commands
use_cases.description: Create plugin command files that use portable paths and bundled scripts.

use_cases.title: Standardize workflows
use_cases.description: Define shared project commands with frontmatter and argument hints for teams.

use_cases.title: Automate reviews
use_cases.description: Build personal commands for code review, docs, and status checks.

prompt_templates.title: Create a first command
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner needs a simple review command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Claude Code slash command to review a repository. Include description and allowed-tools limited to Read and Grep.

prompt_templates.title: Add arguments
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate needs a command with inputs
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a command that documents a file path provided by the user. Use argument-hint and @ file reference.

prompt_templates.title: Use bash context
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate needs git context in output
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a command that shows current branch and recent commits before analysis. Use allowed-tools with Bash(git:*).

prompt_templates.title: Plugin workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced needs a multi step plugin command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plugin command that runs build and test scripts from CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT, then summarizes results and next steps.

output_examples.input: Create a slash command that reviews a pull request by number.
output: Command name and file path for the review
Frontmatter with description, argument hint, and allowed tools
Prompt steps to fetch, review, and report findings
Usage example showing the PR number argument

best_practices: Use clear descriptions and argument hints
Validate inputs and handle missing files
anti_patterns: Writing commands as user messages instead of instructions
Using Bash(*) when specific filters work

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, it targets Claude Code slash commands and works with Codex prompts.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only. It does not run or verify commands.

faq.question: Can it integrate with plugin scripts and templates?
faq.answer: Yes, it documents CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT and shows plugin command patterns.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it is documentation content only and does not collect data.

faq.question: What if my command does not appear in help?
faq.answer: Check file location, .md extension, and frontmatter syntax. Restart Claude Code.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic prompt guides?
faq.answer: It is specific to Claude Code command format and frontmatter fields.
